intro: Thismia ribeiroi, commonly known as the ghost orchid, is a rare and enigmatic flowering plant native to the tropical rainforests of Brazil. It belongs to the family Thismiaceae and is characterized by its unique, almost translucent appearance and lack of visible leaves. The plant produces small, white, orchid-like flowers that are highly specialized for pollination by specific insects. It is an epiphytic plant, growing on the surfaces of trees without deriving nutrients from them. Due to its habitat specificity and rarity, Thismia ribeiroi is considered critically endangered and is often found in protected areas.
